alert.note: Alert for Ashland; Bayfield; Iron; Sawyer (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued December 17 at 10:31PM CST until December 17 at 11:30PM CST by NWS Duluth
info.description: The National Weather Service in Duluth MN has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southeastern Bayfield County in northwestern Wisconsin... Iron County in northwestern Wisconsin... Ashland County in northwestern Wisconsin... Northeastern Sawyer County in northwestern Wisconsin... * Until 1130 PM CST. * At 1028 PM CST, a dangerous snow squall was located near Mellen, or 25 miles north of Park Falls, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This snow squall is impacting WI-13 southeast of Marengo and WI-77. Locations impacted include... Turtle Flambeau Flowage, Mercer, Sanborn, Mellen, Marengo, Butternut, Saxon, Gurney, Upson, Gile, Copper Falls State Park, Glidden, Clam Lake, Namekagon, Namekagon Lake, Montreal, Morse, Pence, Long Lake, and Bad River Reservation. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
